I suppose that's the problem, people want to be offended, because that is what they are taught, that some truly great people stood up and decided that the world was not good enough. but they changed the world already to the way that they saw fit, atleast, they put us on the track, and we have yet to get to the final stop, but to get there, we need to ride it out. if you push us more onto the track all your doing is stopping us.

>  people want to be offended

People don't want to get offended. People want others to do what is right and follow the rules stated in the game. Is it that complicated to swallow?
Offense can only be taken. It's entirely up to you if you choose to be offended or not.

Reread that to yourself.

JIC You don't get your mistake: If offense can **only** be taken then how is it that people can not be offended by something.

I think you are desperately scratching at straws, or misread something critical.

offense can only be taken. 

what you read was.

only offense can be taken. 

These two statements are different. 
notably, the first one implies that the party that is offended is the party that decided to be offended. it also implies that offense can not be given, which would mean that offense is not something that the other party can imbue unto you.
both of those things are true, someone chooses to be offended, even if the other chooses to be offensive.

the second implies that in a situation like that, there is only one outcome, that one party is going to be offended.  however, based on the eve of this argument, with the backing of myself existing as proof, it can be denoted that this statement is intrinsically false.

Please, if you're going to use language picks as a way to argue, use it correctly, it only makes you look the fool otherwise.

You misunderstood my meaning. Offense cannot be given, only taken. Sure, it can be intended, but no one can make you be offended. 

Before calling me out on mistakes, be sure you first actually understand what is being said.
#Bottom line, it's not necessary and people don't like it. Don't name your account or club something immature.
